text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot thai kitchen today I'm 
making an insanely good dessert in Thailand we

call it toffee cake but what it is is a mocha 
cake with a coffee toffee cashew crust on top

I mean that just sounds good I've actually never 
seen this cake outside of Thailand so if you've

seen something similar please let me know I'd love 
to hear more about it and let's get started this
cake typically uses Asian genoise genoise is a type of cake that's a bit tricky to

make it involves egg foam and all that tricky 
stuff so I've modified it to be a very simple

cake basically a dump and stir type cake which 
I love so I've got a pot here which I'm going

to cook my flavor base in and the flavor base is 
coffee and chocolate just a little water and this

water is going to help my coffee dissolve now I 
am using Nescafe which is the most popular type

of instant coffee in Thailand if you don't want 
to buy a whole jar of instant coffee just for

this recipe you could also try a really strong 
brewed espresso or you can try the Starbucks

via if you've got those so once the coffee is 
dissolved I'm going to add the chocolate so this

is semi-sweet chocolate that I've chopped up get 
that mixed up some vegetable oil and some butter

and then I'm just gonna cook this over medium 
medium low heat and you want to be stirring and

scraping the bottom so your chocolate doesn't 
scorch once everything is dissolved and smooth

I'm just gonna set it aside and let it cool 
while we get our other stuff ready I've got

some all-purpose flour here no need to sift it 
because we're gonna whisk everything together I'm

going to add some baking soda and a little bit of 
baking powder some salt and some sugar the sugar

grains will break up any lumps of flour or baking 
powder wet ingredients next I've got two eggs and

I'm very excited to be whisking them with my new 
little tiny whisk so cute some vanilla going in

there yogurt and I'm using full fat yogurt here 
and whisk away I'm slightly obsessed with mini

kitchen utensils you can pose it's like not very 
efficient to the hole so as long as it's smooth

you don't have any more clumps lumps of yogurt 
ready to go and now all we need to do is mix

everything together so my mocha base mmm drink 
that scrape every bit okay this is what a rubber

spat is good for just give it a quick mix just so 
everything is combined together and it'll be very

thick that's okay we're not done yet and when a 
change weapon here to my whisk the egg mixture

and it will slowly come together so easy as you 
can see it's dump and stir and it's really moist

and tender and nice that's it when it's smooth you 
are ready to bake this I am using a quarter sheet

pan basically it's about twelve by eight eight and 
a half if you've got a 12 by nine sort of brownie

pan that'll work as well and I'm going to line it 
with parchment on the bottom but the slides I'm

going to grease with a little bit of oil parchment 
down spread it out when you're pouring so you have

less spreading out to do afterwards that's so 
heavy actually for this I like to use my offset

spatula just run your knife one more time to get 
rid of any large bubbles and to even it out sorry

Amanda spatula these things are so useful by the 
way these little offset spatula for everything

dah-dah-dah here it is to test doneness we can 
just do the standard toothpick test you can see

those holes there you basically use a stick 
the toothpick in the center you pull it out

and if it's clean then you're good to go okay so 
I'm going to let this cake rest and cool for now

while we make the the topping which really is the 
best part of this cake and you don't want to pour

the topping on a very hot cake because right now 
it's not very stable yet it's still really soft

and the topping is quite heavy it'll crush it 
but it doesn't need to cool completely it just

needs to be warm and the cake has stabilized okay 
I'm just gonna put this fine there and we can get

our topping going a little fun fact about cashews 
they're one of the only two types of nuts that we

use in our cooking the other one being obviously 
peanuts however I think this cake would be really

good with pecans so if you want to try go for it 
so I've got some roasted unsalted cashews here

and I'm going to roughly chop them so I run my 
knife over most of them so once I've got most of

them cut in half I'm going to go and pick out the 
ones that are still whole and cut them separately

and the reason why is I don't want to keep cutting 
until everything is you know all cut because then

I got I get a lot of little cashew dust like that 
which I don't want but at the same time I don't

want any whole ones because the whole ones will 
stick up really high on the top and then when

I go to boil the top it'll burn because it sticks 
up higher than everyone else so just go around and

quickly pick out the ones that are either whole 
or just really fat so now I'm going to cut these

ones let's make the most delicious part of this 
cake we're going with some evaporated milk this

is unsweetened it's not the same as condensed 
milk the instant coffee again you could use

the via packets or some strong espresso get that 
resolved a little butter lots and lots of butter

while that's going to set it on low heat I'm 
going to show you a little trick so I've got

sugar here I'm going to add my flour also the 
salt toffee or caramel without salt it's not

good and then I'm going to whisk all this together 
using my other mini whisk and what this does is it

disperses the flour so that when you add it to 
the liquid the flour won't clump up so it's the

same idea as when you make a flour slurry with 
some water you dissolve the flour first so you

don't get clumps you can also put it in a jar and 
shake shake shake once all the butter is gone you

can go ahead and add the sugar flour mixture 
you want to be whisking it at the same time

though so that again you don't have any clumps 
of flour I'm going to change weapon now so I can

scrape the bottom there's something about the 
combination of coffee and butter that smell now

that has come to a boil I am going to stop and go 
in with the cashews I always salivate whenever I

get to this stage because it just smells crazy 
good and that's it that is the topping now the

tip is don't make the topping too far in advance 
because you want the toppings to still be hot and

fluid so you can easily spread it over your cake 
so don't do this while your cake is baking okay

and I'm just gonna go ahead and leather it on so 
compared to the toffee cake that you can get in

Thailand this one has less cake it's something 
that I've always wanted to do because I always

find that the ones in Thailand there's too much 
cake and not enough topping so now I get to make

it exactly how I want it and I always save a 
little bit in the pot because I generally find

that I have to fill the edges in the corner and 
it's just easier to get it from the pot rather

than to try to spread stuff out from the middle 
this is the funnest part it's the part where the

topping becomes toffee we're going to put this 
under the broiler and it's going to caramelize

and brown the top and it also dry it up so that 
we can cut it a little the topic don't run a

were everywhere all right so just to show 
you what this looks like this one browned

a little too much in the middle but it's still 
okay this is actually my first time using this

oven to broil it the edges aren't as browned as 
the one in the center that's typical so you try

to move the pan as much as you can but before you 
cut it you want to let it cool completely because

this is still soft so you want to wait until 
the sugar is cool before we take it out but I

have one ready okay so this is one that I made 
at home as you can see it's a little more even

because I know my oven a little better so I'm 
able to manipulate it cutting there's a little

trick to this you want to first flip it out before 
you do that you want to loosen the sides put the

cutting board on top of the pan hold firmly and 
and then you hope that it comes out that I peel

off the parchment so there's a little bit of a 
trick in cutting this cake you want to cut it

upside down because if you cut it through the 
nuts the nuts will crush the cake so I'm just

going to make incisions until I hit the nuts I'm 
not cutting through the nuts with a serrated knife

you're going to go in with a regular chef's 
knife and cut the nuts in one confident move

just like that okay now this cake keeps really 
well you can give it to your friends in a care

package let's try it I love that coffee flavor 
and the combination of the coffee flavor and

the caramelized sugar oh my god the cake is rich 
and moist and the tops crunchy it's just so so

good I promise you you give this to your friends 
your family your loved ones and they are going to

love it and then love you for it so I hope you 
give this a try it's a little bit of work but

it's really not difficult and when you do make it 
send me a photo on Facebook Twitter or Instagram

and the recipe as always is on top I am calm and I 
will see you next time for your next delicious hi
